intro: Hieracium dolichotrichum, commonly known as the long-hairy hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, preferring full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are lance-shaped with hairy surfaces, and the flowers are yellow with ray florets. It is often found in temperate climates and can thrive in a variety of soil types.
